alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Morris; Titus (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 13 at 9:48PM CST until February 14 at 3:43PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... White Oak Creek Near Talco affecting Morris, Titus and Franklin Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...White Oak Creek Near Talco. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Expect minor lowland flooding of creek bottoms. Ranchers that may have cattle and equipment in the creek bottoms should move them to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM CST Monday the stage was 16.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 PM CST Monday was 16.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 11.8 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.0 feet on 11/06/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at 345 PM CST.
